src/embeddings.ts:EmbeddingProvider.name: EmbeddingProvider
src/embeddings.ts:EmbeddingProvider.summary: Interface defining an embedding provider with initialize, embed, and dimension properties.

src/embeddings.ts:SimpleEmbeddingProvide.name: SimpleEmbeddingProvider
src/embeddings.ts:SimpleEmbeddingProvide.summary: Class implementing EmbeddingProvider with basic n-gram based text embedding.

src/embeddings.ts:embed.name: embed
src/embeddings.ts:embed.summary: Converts a given text into a numeric vector representation.

src/embeddings.ts:hashString.name: hashString
src/embeddings.ts:hashString.summary: Private function to hash a string using FNV-1a hash algorithm.

src/embeddings.ts:TensorFlowEmbeddingPro.name: TensorFlowEmbeddingProvider
src/embeddings.ts:TensorFlowEmbeddingPro.summary: Class implementing EmbeddingProvider using TensorFlow for text embedding.

src/embeddings.ts:constructor.name: constructor
src/embeddings.ts:constructor.summary: Constructor for TensorFlowEmbeddingProvider, setting the model path.

src/embeddings.ts:loadModelFromFiles.name: loadModelFromFiles
src/embeddings.ts:loadModelFromFiles.summary: Loads the TensorFlow model from the specified files, combining the model topology and weight data.

src/embeddings.ts:createEmbeddingProvide.name: createEmbeddingProvider
src/embeddings.ts:createEmbeddingProvide.summary: Creates and initializes a TensorFlow embedding provider, falling back to a simple hash embeddings provider if TensorFlow is unavailable.

src/engine.ts:CodeGraphNode.name: CodeGraphNode
src/engine.ts:CodeGraphNode.summary: Represents a code symbol within a project's graph. It includes identifying information like kind, name, and path, along with location details (byte offsets, line numbers) and a checksum for content verification.

src/engine.ts:Requirement.name: Requirement
src/engine.ts:Requirement.summary: The `Requirement` interface defines a structured representation of a software requirement. It includes a unique identifier, a textual description, a list of acceptance criteria, associated code node IDs, and a checksum for content integrity.

src/engine.ts:SpecMap.name: SpecMap
src/engine.ts:SpecMap.summary: The `SpecMap` interface serves as a comprehensive container for code analysis results, holding a record of `CodeGraphNode` objects by their IDs. Optionally, it can also store a record of `Requirement` objects, effectively mapping the codebase's structure to its formal specifications.

src/engine.ts:LanguageConfig.name: LanguageConfig
src/engine.ts:LanguageConfig.summary: Configuration object for a specific programming language. It holds the language's parser, a query for extracting symbols, and associated file extensions.

src/engine.ts:ExtractionEngine.name: ExtractionEngine
src/engine.ts:ExtractionEngine.summary: The ExtractionEngine class is responsible for extracting code symbols from source files and generating a map of nodes and specifications.

src/engine.ts:constructor.name: constructor
src/engine.ts:constructor.summary: Initializes the ExtractionEngine by setting up a new Parser instance. It configures language support for Rust and TypeScript, defining specific queries and file extensions for each.

src/engine.ts:getConfigForFile.name: getConfigForFile
src/engine.ts:getConfigForFile.summary: Retrieves the LanguageConfig based on the file extension. It looks up the configuration in the engine's internal 'configs' map.

src/engine.ts:extractAll.name: extractAll
src/engine.ts:extractAll.summary: The extractAll method traverses the file system, extracts symbols from source files, summarizes them, and generates specifications based on the extracted symbols.

src/engine.ts:walk.name: walk
src/engine.ts:walk.summary: Recursively walks through directories starting from a given directory. It identifies files with supported language configurations, respecting ignore rules, and adds them to a list for processing, while skipping common directories like node_modules.

src/engine.ts:processBatch.name: processBatch
src/engine.ts:processBatch.summary: Processes a batch of nodes, summarizing their code and updating the specification map.

src/engine.ts:calculateRequirementChecks.name: calculateRequirementChecksum
src/engine.ts:calculateRequirementChecks.summary: This helper function computes a SHA-256 checksum for a given array of code symbol IDs. It sorts the input IDs and concatenates each ID with its corresponding node's checksum from the `specMap`, ensuring a consistent composite string. The resulting string is then hashed to produce a unique checksum, which is used to detect changes in requirements for specifications.

src/engine.ts:processSpecBatch.name: processSpecBatch
src/engine.ts:processSpecBatch.summary: Asynchronously processes a batch of code graph nodes, summarizing them and updating the specifications map.

src/engine.ts:extractFile.name: extractFile
src/engine.ts:extractFile.summary: Extracts code symbols from a single file based on its language configuration. It parses the file content, applies the language-specific query to find matches, and generates CodeGraphNode objects for each identified symbol.

src/engine.ts:saveSpecMap.name: saveSpecMap
src/engine.ts:saveSpecMap.summary: Saves the provided SpecMap to a JSON file named 'spec-map.json' within the '.drew' directory in the project's root path. It ensures the '.drew' directory exists before writing the file with pretty printing.

src/index.ts:printPrettyResults.name: printPrettyResults
src/index.ts:printPrettyResults.summary: This function logs search results for a given query, printing a message if no results are found.

src/index.ts:printPrettyResult.name: printPrettyResult
src/index.ts:printPrettyResult.summary: This function logs the details of a search result, formatting it based on whether it is a node or a specification.

src/summarizer.ts:SummarizerSettings.name: SummarizerSettings
src/summarizer.ts:SummarizerSettings.summary: Defines the settings for the summarizer, including the provider, model, and optional API keys.

src/summarizer.ts:Summarizer.name: Summarizer
src/summarizer.ts:Summarizer.summary: The `Summarizer` interface defines a contract for services capable of generating technical summaries from code snippets and producing structured specifications. It includes methods for single-code summarization, batch summarization by ID, and a `specialize` method for creating formal requirements based on summaries.

src/summarizer.ts:splitIntoChunks.name: splitIntoChunks
src/summarizer.ts:splitIntoChunks.summary: Splits an array of items into a specified number of chunks.

src/summarizer.ts:AISummarizer.name: AISummarizer
src/summarizer.ts:AISummarizer.summary: A class that uses an AI model to summarize code symbols and generate requirements, supporting multiple AI providers.

src/summarizer.ts:constructor.name: constructor
src/summarizer.ts:constructor.summary: The constructor for the AISummarizer class, which initializes the instance with the provided SummarizerSettings.

src/summarizer.ts:getModel.name: getModel
src/summarizer.ts:getModel.summary: Returns a language model based on the provider settings.

src/summarizer.ts:summarize.name: summarize
src/summarizer.ts:summarize.summary: Summarizes a given code symbol using a language model.

src/summarizer.ts:summarizeBatch.name: summarizeBatch
src/summarizer.ts:summarizeBatch.summary: This function takes an array of items, each with an ID and code, and returns a summary for each item. If the provider is 'mock', it generates a mock summary. Otherwise, it uses a model to generate summaries in parallel.

src/summarizer.ts:specialize.name: specialize
src/summarizer.ts:specialize.summary: This function takes an array of items, each with an ID and summary, and returns a detailed specification for each item. If the provider is 'mock', it generates a mock specification. Otherwise, it uses a model to generate specifications in parallel.

src/summarizer.ts:loadSettings.name: loadSettings
src/summarizer.ts:loadSettings.summary: This function loads the summarizer settings from a file. It checks for the provider type and ensures all necessary settings are provided. It returns the settings object with the provider, model, and other relevant details.

src/vectorstore.ts:SearchResult.name: SearchResult
src/vectorstore.ts:SearchResult.summary: A structure representing a search result, including the document's ID, type, score, and data.

src/vectorstore.ts:nodeSearchableText.name: nodeSearchableText
src/vectorstore.ts:nodeSearchableText.summary: Extracts searchable text from a node for indexing.

src/vectorstore.ts:specSearchableText.name: specSearchableText
src/vectorstore.ts:specSearchableText.summary: Extracts searchable text from a specification for indexing.

src/vectorstore.ts:encodeId.name: encodeId
src/vectorstore.ts:encodeId.summary: Encodes a string ID into a format suitable for use as a document ID in the vector store.

src/vectorstore.ts:decodeId.name: decodeId
src/vectorstore.ts:decodeId.summary: Decodes a base64url encoded string to a readable string.

src/vectorstore.ts:buildSchema.name: buildSchema
src/vectorstore.ts:buildSchema.summary: Builds a schema for a vector collection with specified fields and index parameters.

src/vectorstore.ts:DrewVectorStore.name: DrewVectorStore
src/vectorstore.ts:DrewVectorStore.summary: A DrewVectorStore class manages a vector database collection for storing and searching nodes and specifications with embeddings.

src/vectorstore.ts:constructor.name: constructor
src/vectorstore.ts:constructor.summary: Initializes the DrewVectorStore class with a root path and an embedder.

src/vectorstore.ts:create.name: create
src/vectorstore.ts:create.summary: Creates or reindexes the vector store based on the provided schema.

src/vectorstore.ts:open.name: open
src/vectorstore.ts:open.summary: Opens an existing vector store if it exists.

src/vectorstore.ts:indexAll.name: indexAll
src/vectorstore.ts:indexAll.summary: Indexes all nodes and specifications into the vector store, updating or inserting them as necessary.

src/vectorstore.ts:search.name: search
src/vectorstore.ts:search.summary: The search method in DrewVectorStore class allows searching for nodes and specifications based on a query, limit, and optional type filter.

src/vectorstore.ts:get.name: get
src/vectorstore.ts:get.summary: Asynchronously retrieves a single document from the vector store by its encoded ID, returning the document or null if not found.

src/vectorstore.ts:delete.name: delete
src/vectorstore.ts:delete.summary: Asynchronously deletes a document from the vector store by its encoded ID, returning true if the document was found and deleted.

src/vectorstore.ts:close.name: close
src/vectorstore.ts:close.summary: Closes the vector store, ensuring all resources are released and the collection is marked as null.

src/vectorstore.ts:resolveResults.name: resolveResults
src/vectorstore.ts:resolveResults.summary: Resolves search results into a list of SearchResult objects, including linked nodes for spec documents.

tests/vectorstore.test.ts:makeSpecMap.name: makeSpecMap
tests/vectorstore.test.ts:makeSpecMap.summary: Creates a SpecMap object with nodes and specifications for testing, simulating a map of code symbols and requirements.

REQ-CODEGRAPHNODE-1.description: The system SHALL represent code symbols with identifiable information, location details, and a content verification mechanism.
acceptance_criteria: The CodeGraphNode SHALL include kind, name, and path.
The CodeGraphNode SHALL include byte_offset and line_number.
The CodeGraphNode SHALL include a checksum for content verification.

REQ-REQUIREMENT-1.description: The system SHALL provide a structured representation for software requirements.
acceptance_criteria: A Requirement SHALL have a unique id.
A Requirement SHALL have a description.
A Requirement SHALL have acceptance_criteria.
A Requirement SHALL have associated node_ids.
A Requirement SHALL have a checksum for content integrity.

REQ-SPECMAP-1.description: The system SHALL maintain a comprehensive map of code analysis results.
acceptance_criteria: The SpecMap SHALL store CodeGraphNode objects by their IDs.
The SpecMap MAY store Requirement objects.

REQ-LANGCONFIG-1.description: The system SHALL support configurable language parsing.
acceptance_criteria: A LanguageConfig SHALL specify the parser for a language.
A LanguageConfig SHALL specify a query for symbol extraction.
A LanguageConfig SHALL list associated file_extensions.

REQ-CONSTRUCTOR-1.description: The ExtractionEngine SHALL be initialized with configured language support.
acceptance_criteria: The constructor SHALL set up a new Parser instance.
The constructor SHALL configure language support for Rust.
The constructor SHALL configure language support for TypeScript.
The constructor SHALL define specific queries and file extensions for each language.

REQ-GETCONFIGFORFILE-1.description: The system SHALL retrieve language configurations based on file extensions.
acceptance_criteria: getConfigForFile SHALL look up the configuration in the engine's internal 'configs' map.
getConfigForFile SHALL return the correct LanguageConfig for a given file extension.

REQ-WALK-1.description: The system SHALL recursively traverse directories to identify supported files.
acceptance_criteria: walk SHALL start from a given directory.
walk SHALL identify files with supported language configurations.
walk SHALL respect ignore rules.
walk SHALL skip common directories such as node_modules.
walk SHALL add identified files to a list for processing.

REQ-ENGINE-CHECKSUM-001.description: The system shall compute a SHA-256 checksum for an array of code symbol IDs and their corresponding node checksums to detect changes in specifications.
acceptance_criteria: The checksum shall be computed using the SHA-256 algorithm.
The checksum calculation shall incorporate sorted input symbol IDs.
The checksum calculation shall incorporate each symbol ID's corresponding node checksum from the `specMap`.
The checksum shall consistently reflect changes in the input symbol IDs or their associated node checksums.

REQ-ENGINE-EXTRACT-001.description: The system shall extract code symbols from a given file based on its language configuration.
acceptance_criteria: The system shall successfully parse the content of the provided file.
The system shall apply language-specific queries to identify code symbols within the file.
The system shall generate `CodeGraphNode` objects for each identified code symbol.

REQ-ENGINE-SAVEMAP-001.description: The system shall save the generated `SpecMap` to a JSON file named 'spec-map.json' within the '.drew' directory in the project's root path.
acceptance_criteria: The file shall be named 'spec-map.json'.
The file shall be located in the '.drew' directory.
The '.drew' directory shall be created if it does not already exist.
The JSON file content shall be pretty-printed for readability.

REQ-SUMMARIZER-INTERFACE-001.description: The system shall provide an interface for services capable of generating technical summaries from code snippets and producing structured specifications.
acceptance_criteria: The interface shall define a method for summarizing a single code snippet.
The interface shall define a method for summarizing multiple code snippets in a batch by ID.
The interface shall define a `specialize` method for creating formal requirements based on summaries.

src/summarizer.ts:SummarizerSettings.description: Define the settings for the summarizer, including the provider, model, and optional API keys.
acceptance_criteria: SummarizerSettings should define the settings for the summarizer.
SummarizerSettings should include the provider, model, and optional API keys.

src/summarizer.ts:constructor.description: The constructor for the AISummarizer class, which initializes the instance with the provided SummarizerSettings.
acceptance_criteria: constructor should initialize the AISummarizer instance with the provided SummarizerSettings.

src/summarizer.ts:getModel.description: Return a language model based on the provider settings.
acceptance_criteria: getModel should return a language model based on the provider settings.

src/summarizer.ts:summarize.description: Summarize a given code symbol using a language model.
acceptance_criteria: summarize should summarize a given code symbol using a language model.

src/vectorstore.ts:indexAll.description: The system shall index all nodes and specifications into the vector store, updating or inserting them as necessary.
acceptance_criteria: The system can index all nodes and specifications into the vector store.
The system can update or insert nodes and specifications into the vector store as necessary.

src/vectorstore.ts:get.description: The system shall asynchronously retrieve a single document from the vector store by its encoded ID, returning the document or null if not found.
acceptance_criteria: The system can asynchronously retrieve a single document from the vector store.
The system returns the document if it is found.
The system returns null if the document is not found.

src/vectorstore.ts:delete.description: Asynchronously deletes a document from the vector store by its encoded ID, returning true if the document was found and deleted.
acceptance_criteria: The function should accept an encoded ID as input.
The function should return true if the document was found and deleted.
The function should return false if the document was not found.

src/vectorstore.ts:close.description: Closes the vector store, ensuring all resources are released and the collection is marked as null.
acceptance_criteria: The function should release all resources associated with the vector store.
The function should mark the collection as null after closing.

src/vectorstore.ts:resolveResults.description: Resolves search results into a list of SearchResult objects, including linked nodes for spec documents.
acceptance_criteria: The function should accept search results as input.
The function should return a list of SearchResult objects.
Each SearchResult object should include linked nodes for spec documents.

tests/vectorstore.test.ts:makeSpecMap.description: Creates a SpecMap object with nodes and specifications for testing, simulating a map of code symbols and requirements.
acceptance_criteria: SpecMap object is created successfully.
SpecMap object contains the correct nodes and specifications.
SpecMap object can be used to simulate a map of code symbols and requirements for testing.

src/vectorstore.ts:search.description: The search method in DrewVectorStore class allows searching for nodes and specifications based on a query, limit, and optional type filter.
acceptance_criteria: The search method should return a list of nodes and specifications that match the query.
The search method should support limiting the number of results returned.
The search method should support an optional type filter to restrict results to a specific type.

src/embeddings.ts:EmbeddingProvider.description: An interface defining an embedding provider with initialize, embed, and dimension properties.
acceptance_criteria: The interface should have an initialize method that asynchronously initializes the embeddings.
The interface should have an embed method that converts a given text into a numeric vector representation.
The interface should have a dimension property that returns the dimensionality of the embeddings.

src/embeddings.ts:SimpleEmbeddingProvide.description: A class implementing EmbeddingProvider with basic n-gram based text embedding.
acceptance_criteria: The class should implement the EmbeddingProvider interface.
The class should provide an n-gram based text embedding.
The class should handle edge cases such as empty or very short text inputs gracefully.
The method should return a Promise that resolves when the embeddings are initialized.
The method should handle errors during initialization gracefully.

src/embeddings.ts:embed.description: Converts a given text into a numeric vector representation.
acceptance_criteria: The method should return a numeric vector representation of the given text.
The method should handle errors during embedding gracefully.

src/embeddings.ts:hashString.description: Private function to hash a string using FNV-1a hash algorithm.
acceptance_criteria: The function should return a hash value for the given string.
The function should use the FNV-1a hash algorithm.

src/embeddings.ts:TensorFlowEmbeddingPro.description: Class implementing EmbeddingProvider using TensorFlow for text embedding.
acceptance_criteria: The class should implement the EmbeddingProvider interface.
The class should use TensorFlow for text embedding.
The class should handle errors during TensorFlow operations gracefully.

src/embeddings.ts:constructor.description: Constructor for TensorFlowEmbeddingProvider, setting the model path.
acceptance_criteria: The constructor should set the model path for the TensorFlowEmbeddingProvider.
The constructor should handle errors during model path setting gracefully.

src/embeddings.ts:loadModelFromFiles.description: Loads the TensorFlow model from the specified files, combining the model topology and weight data.
acceptance_criteria: The method should load the TensorFlow model from the specified files.
The method should handle errors during model loading gracefully.

src/embeddings.ts:createEmbeddingProvide.description: Creates and initializes a TensorFlow embedding provider, falling back to a simple hash embeddings provider if TensorFlow is unavailable.
acceptance_criteria: The method should create and initialize a TensorFlow embedding provider.
The method should fall back to a simple hash embeddings provider if TensorFlow is unavailable.
